alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 11:16PM CST until January 04 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Choctaw, Clarke and Washington. In southeast Mississippi, Greene, Perry and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1115 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chatom, Richton, Saint Stephens, Clara, Beaumont, New Augusta, Millry, Buckatunna, State Line, Silas, Coffeeville, Belmont, Battles, Eret, Chicora, Mehaffey, Denham, Winchester, Shady Grove and Yellow Pine.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
